result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary L Donovan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $250.00. DNA PAID. $163.00 due on Court Costs.
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Contact with her child be only as recommended by the Dept. of Human Services and/or her Agent.
Be compliant with all orders of Courts with competent jurisdiction.
Parenting class as approved and directed by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Defendant to report to the Sheriff's Dept within 3 business days to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - nonworking hours (w/huber) FORTHWITH. Last 5 days STAYED to be used at the Agent's discretion, as well as to Huber/straight time.

Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Mary L Donovan in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.
 
Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 7 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - Apply balance of bail
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - Apply bail
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. Contact with her child be only as recommended by the Department of Human Services and/or her Agent. Be compliant with all orders of Courts with competent jurisdiction. Parenting class as approved and directed by the Agent.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 -  20 days jail Condition Time with huber (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH.  Last 5 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agent's discretion. 
- Defendant to report to the Waukesha County Sheriff Department within (3) business days to  provide a DNA sample.
From the Defendant's social worker filed by Attorney Kay.
Sentencing hearing on April 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.

COURT ORDERED A $250.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $5000.00 SIGNATURE BOND PREVIOUSLY SET.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to comply with all Juvenile Orders.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Mary L Donovan in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Court will give another date for sentencing. Defendant to report to WCS after Court today. Court orders defendant to post $250.00 cash in addition to the $5,000 signature bond previously posted.  .  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on March 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Hearing on March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
